After the work required to complete the change is finished or the change has been backed out, it is considered complete and is ready for review. This review is commonly known as a Post Implementation Review (PIR). The review is an important part of the change management process, as it is continually checking that the procedures are still effective, and identifying lessons learned or improvements.
 
Configure the Change Request form for a simple post implementation review process.

false change_review_close 3 6 false true It is recommended that you conduct a simple review of all changes. This review is conducted to identify whether the change was successful. There are three results:

 Result Description
 Successful The desired result was achieved following the plan in the agreed time frame.
 Successful with issues The desired result was achieved, however it may have required different steps than originally planned, have taken longer than planned, or experienced unexpected results.
 Unsuccessful The desired result was not achieved. This may have resulted in the change being backed out.

 

The following list provides additional configuration recommendations for the review process:

  • If Successful is selected, the change is closed with no further action.
  • If one of the other options is selected, the user must provide further details in the Close Notes field to explain what happened. This allows a change manager to decide what further action to take.
  • Changes with related change tasks that have a Type field set to Planning, Testing, or Implementing cannot move to Review state until those change tasks are closed
  • Changes with related change tasks that have a Type field set to Reviewing cannot move to Closed state until those change tasks are closed.

 

To configure proven practice process for post implementation review, click the Change Request form context menu and select Configure > Form Layout.

  1. Modify the base system UI Action Close to include a check for active change tasks. If found, display a form error message and do not move the change to Close.
  2. Modify the base system UI Action Review to include a check for active, non-review change task types. If found, display a form error message and do not move change to Review.
  3. Add a UI policy to set the Close notes field to mandatory when Closure code is Unsuccessful.
  4. Modify the base system UI policy Mandatory - Close notes and code when in Closed state so that close notes are not always mandatory in Closed state. A new UI policy makes it mandatory only if the change is unsuccessful.
  5. Add a business rule to clear the Close code and set tasks to Active if the change request goes back into an active state.
